resources.string:
THIS IS THE GAME OF TWONKY. IN IT YOU PRETEND TO BE A SPACE EXPLORER WHO HAS LANDED ON A HOSTILE PLANET.

 CAPTURED BY THE UNFRIENDLY NATIVES, YOU ARE TOSSED INTO A LARGE PRISON ALONG WITH A FEROCIOUS TWONKY.

 A TWONKY IS A HORRIBLE CREATURE WHO WILL CATCH YOU AND ABSORB YOUR BODY INTO HIS IF HE GETS CLOSER THAN TWO UNITS AWAY FROM YOU.

IN THE INTEREST OF FAIR PLAY, YOU ARE GIVEN A ZAP GUN THAT WILL TEMPORARILY CHASE THE TWONKY AWAY.

 ALSO, IF YOU CAN MAKE IT TO THE SPECIAL OBJECTIVE SQUARE BEFORE BEING ABSORBED, YOU WILL BE SET FREE.

 AFTER YOU MOVE, YOU WILL BE INFORMED OF YOUR DISTANCE FROM THE OBJECTIVE SQUARE AS WELL AS FROM THE TWONKY.

THERE ARE SEVERAL OTHER OBJECTS IN THE MAZE WHICH ARE OF INTEREST

 THERE ARE TWENTY RELOCATION SQUARES. THESE SQUARES SEND YOU TO SOME OTHER PLACE IN THE MAZE.

 THERE ARE TWENTY IMPREGNABLE SQUARES WHICH YOU CANNOT ENTER.

 THERE IS ONE SUPER DEADLY AUTOMATIC KILL SQUARE WHICH ENDS YOUR ORDEAL QUICKLY AND PAINLESSLY.

 THAT'S IT … TRY TO ENJOY IT!

Twonky is a simple text game. It's based on code ported from an early terminal-style computer, the DEC-PDP-8, written in BASIC and ported to the Apple II.

by: Mark Capella
markcapella@twcny.rr.com
irc nick:capella
Enter a command and press Done …
